oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Performance - Night Train to Nashville Volume 2 CD release party - 2005-10-01
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Program and performances surrounding the release of Volume 2 of the Night Train to Nashville: Music City Rhythm and Blues 1947-1970 CD project from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on October 1, 2005. In support of the exhibit "Night Train to Nashville: Music City Rhythm and Blues".
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Johnny Jones; Charles Walker; Buzz Cason; Hal Hardy; Deford Bailey Jr.; Bobby Hebb; Frank Howard; Rickey Godfrey; Sandra King; Earl Gaines; Marion James;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Program begins in progress. Opening comments and introductions by Michael Gray. Introduction of the house band. Performances include: Unidentified Instrumental (Johnny Jones-guitar) -- Slave To Love (Charles "Wigg" Walker) -- Lucky Lou (Johnny Jones-guitar) -- Soldier Of Love (Buzz Cason) -- Stormy Monday (Hal Hardy with Deford Bailey Jr. on bass) -- Stand By Me (Hal Hardy) -- Sunny (Bobby Hebb) -- Judy (Frank Howard) -- Soul Poppin' (Johnny Jones-guitar) -- Screamin' And Shoutin' (Rickey Godfrey) -- Leave It Up To The Boys (Sandra King) -- I Believe In You (Sandra King-a capella) -- Happy Birthday- to Sandra (Rickey Godfrey) -- She's All I Got (Rickey Godfrey) -- Don't Take My Kindness For A Weakness (Earl Gaines) -- It's Love Baby (24 Hours A Day) (Earl Gaines) -- That's My Man (Marion James) -- closing comments.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jones, Johnny; Walker, Charles; Cason, Buzz; Hardy, Hal; Bailey Jr., Deford; Hebb, Bobby; Howard, Frank; Godfrey, Rickey; King, Sandra; Gaines, Earl; James, Marion; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
